This means that NPV can be increased by increasing the number of true negatives or decreasing the number of false negatives. Since the test already has a high number of true negatives (850 out of 880 total negatives), the best way to increase NPV would be to decrease the prevalence of HIV in the tested population, as this would decrease the number of false negatives. Therefore, the correct answer is (B). Increased prevalence of HIV would actually decrease NPV, as it would increase the number of false negatives. Increased false positive test results and false negative test results would also decrease NPV.
